title.narrative: 04.04 Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Minimum Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services are provided to people affected by Emergency situations, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the prevalence of diarrhea is reduced by 15% and the incidence of helminth infections reduced by 10% and at least 30% of parents, guardians, heads of families and children wash their hands with soap and water at crucial moments, consume drinking safe water and know how to treat water at their home before consumption and use hygienic

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Minimum WASH services are provided to people affected by Emergency situations

description.narrative: UNICEF supported an integrated UN response to floods in Conakry, Kankan and N'Zerekore and landslide in Conakry, thus improving the resilience of 300 families (2,500 people, including 1,360 children) in the affected areas. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2017
